briefdescription.para: Reads index groups from a file or constructs them from topology.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group structure.
top
Topology structure.
fnm
File name for the index file. Memory is automatically allocated.
One or both of top or fnm can be NULL. If top is NULL, an index file is required and the groups are read from the file (uses Gromacs routine init_index()). If fnm is NULL, default groups are constructed based on the topology (uses Gromacs routine analyse()). If both are null, the index group structure is initialized empty.

briefdescription.para: Frees memory allocated for index groups.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index groups structure.
The pointer g is invalid after the call.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the index group structure is emtpy.

simplesect.para: true if g is empty, i.e., has 0 index groups.

briefdescription.para: Returns a pointer to an index group.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index groups structure.
n
Index group number to get.
Pointer to the n'th index group in g. The returned pointer should not be freed.

briefdescription.para: Extracts a single index group.

parameterdescription.para: Receives the name of the group if found.
Number of the group to extract.

simplesect.para: true if n is a valid group in src, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Finds and extracts a single index group by name.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output structure.
destName
Receives the name of the group if found.
src
Input index groups.
name
Name (or part of the name) of the group to extract.
true if name is a valid group in src, false otherwise. Uses the Gromacs routine find_group() to find the actual group; the comparison is case-insensitive.

briefdescription.para: Writes out a list of index groups.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of indices to print (-1 = print all, 0 = print only names).

briefdescription.para: Reserves memory to store an index group of size isize.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of atoms to reserve space for.

briefdescription.para: Frees any memory not necessary to hold the current contents.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group structure.
Resizes the memory allocated for holding the indices such that the current contents fit.

briefdescription.para: Initializes an empty index group.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Output structure.
Any contents of g are discarded without freeing.

briefdescription.para: Constructs a gmx_ana_index_t from given values.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Output structure.
isize
Number of atoms in the new group.
index
Array of isize atoms (can be NULL if isize is 0).
nalloc
Number of elements allocated for index (if 0, index is not freed in gmx_ana_index_deinit())
No copy if index is made.

briefdescription.para: Creates a simple index group from the first to the natoms'th atom.
Frees memory allocated for an index group.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group structure.
The pointer g is not freed.

briefdescription.para: Copies a gmx_ana_index_t.

parameterdescription.para: If true, memory is allocated at dest; otherwise, it is assumed that enough memory has been allocated for index.

briefdescription.para: Writes out the contents of a index group.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of indices to print (-1 = print all).

briefdescription.para: Returns maximum atom index that appears in an index group.

simplesect.para: Largest atom index that appears in g, or zero if g is empty.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether an index group is sorted.

simplesect.para: true if the index group is sorted and has no duplicates, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether an index group has atoms from a defined range.

simplesect.para: true if all atoms in the index group are in the range 0 to natoms (i.e., no atoms over natoms are referenced).

briefdescription.para: Helper function for gmx_ana_index_sort().
Sorts the indices within an index group.
Removes duplicates from a sorted index group.
Checks whether two index groups are equal.

simplesect.para: true if a and b are equal, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a sorted index group contains another sorted index group.

detaileddescription.para:
a
Index group to check against.
b
Index group to check.
true if b is contained in a, false otherwise. If the elements are not in the same order in both groups, the function fails. However, the groups do not need to be sorted.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the intersection between two sorted index groups.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output index group (the intersection of a and b).
a
First index group.
b
Second index group.
dest can be the same as a or b.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the set difference between two sorted index groups.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output index group (the difference a - b).
a
First index group.
b
Second index group.
dest can equal a, but not b.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the size of the difference between two sorted index groups.

simplesect.para: Size of the difference a - b.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the intersection and the difference in one call.

detaileddescription.para:
dest1
Output group 1 (will equal g).
dest2
Output group 2 (will equal src - g).
src
Group to be partitioned.
g
One partition.
g is a subset of src and both sets are sorted
dest1 has allocated storage to store src
dest1 == g
dest2 == src - g No storage should be allocated for dest2; after the call, dest2->index points to the memory allocated for dest1 (to a part that is not used by dest1).
The calculation can be performed in-place by setting dest1 equal to src.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the union of two sorted index groups.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output index group (the union of a and b).
a
First index group.
b
Second index group.
a and b can have common items. dest can equal a or b.

briefdescription.para: Calculates the union of two index groups, where the second group may not be sorted.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output index group (the union of a and b).
a
First index group (must be sorted).
b
Second index group.
a and b can have common items. dest can equal a or b.

briefdescription.para: Merges two distinct sorted index groups.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Output index group (the union of a and b).
a
First index group.
b
Second index group.
a and b should not have common items. dest can equal a or b.

briefdescription.para: Helper for splitting a sequence of atom indices into groups.

detaileddescription.para:
atomIndex
Index of the next atom in the sequence.
top
Topology structure.
type
Type of group to split into.
id
Variable to receive the next group id.
true if atomIndex starts a new group in the sequence, i.e., if *id was changed. *id should be initialized to -1 before first call of this function, and then each atom index in the sequence passed to the function in turn.

memberdef.argsstring: (t_blocka *t, t_topology *top, gmx_ana_index_t *g, e_index_t type, bool bComplete)
memberdef.name: gmx_ana_index_make_block

briefdescription.para: Partition a group based on topology information.

detaileddescription.para:
t
Output block.
top
Topology structure (only used if type is INDEX_RES or INDEX_MOL, can be NULL otherwise).
g
Index group (can be NULL if type is INDEX_UNKNOWN).
type
Type of partitioning to make.
bComplete
If true, the index group is expanded to include any residue/molecule (depending on type) that is partially contained in the group. If type is not INDEX_RES or INDEX_MOL, this has no effect.
m should have been initialized somehow (calloc() is enough). g should be sorted.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a group consists of full blocks.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group to check.
b
Block data to check against.
true if g consists of one or more complete blocks from b, false otherwise. The atoms in g are assumed to be sorted.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a group consists of full blocks.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group to check.
b
Block data to check against.
true if g consists of one or more complete blocks from b, false otherwise. The atoms in g and b->a are assumed to be in the same order.

briefdescription.para: Checks whether a group consists of full residues/molecules.

detaileddescription.para:
g
Index group to check.
type
Block data to check against.
top
Topology data.
true if g consists of one or more complete elements of type type, false otherwise. g is assumed to be sorted, otherwise may return false negatives.
If type is INDEX_ATOM, the return value is always true. If type is INDEX_UNKNOWN or INDEX_ALL, the return value is always false.

briefdescription.para: Initializes an empty index group mapping.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Output structure.
Any contents of m are discarded without freeing.

briefdescription.para: Reserves memory for an index group mapping.

parameterdescription.para: Maximum number of blocks to reserve space for.
Maximum number of atoms to reserve space for.

briefdescription.para: Initializes an index group mapping.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Mapping structure to initialize.
g
Index group to map (can be NULL if type is INDEX_UNKNOWN).
top
Topology structure (can be NULL if type is not INDEX_RES or INDEX_MOL).
type
Type of mapping to construct.
Initializes a new index group mapping. The index group provided to gmx_ana_indexmap_update() should always be a subset of the g given here.
m should have been initialized somehow (calloc() is enough).

briefdescription.para: Initializes orgid entries based on topology grouping.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Mapping structure to use/initialize.
top
Topology structure (can be NULL if not required for type).
type
Type of groups to use.
The number of groups of type type that were present in m.
InconsistentInputError
if the blocks in m do not have a unique group (e.g., contain atoms from multiple residues with type == INDEX_RES).
By default, the gmx_ana_indexmap_t::orgid fields are initialized to atom/residue/molecule indices from the topology (see documentation for the struct for more details). This function can be used to set the field to a zero-based group index instead. The first block will always get orgid[0] = 0, and all following blocks that belong to the same residue/molecule (type) will get the same index. Each time a block does not belong to the same group, it will get the next available number. If type == INDEX_ATOM, the orgid field is initialized as 0, 1, ..., independent of whether the blocks are single atoms or not.
Strong exception safety guarantee.

briefdescription.para: Sets an index group mapping to be static.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Mapping structure to initialize.
b
Block information to use for data.
Frees some memory that is not necessary for static index group mappings. Internal pointers are set to point to data in b; it is the responsibility of the caller to ensure that the block information matches the contents of the mapping. After this function has been called, the index group provided to gmx_ana_indexmap_update() should always be the same as g given here.
This function breaks modularity of the index group mapping interface in an ugly way, but allows reducing memory usage of static selections by a significant amount.

briefdescription.para: Makes a deep copy of an index group mapping.

detaileddescription.para:
dest
Destination data structure.
src
Source mapping.
bFirst
If true, memory is allocated for dest and a full copy is made; otherwise, only variable parts are copied, and no memory is allocated.
dest should have been initialized somehow (calloc() is enough).

briefdescription.para: Helper function to set the source atoms in an index map.

parameterdescription.para: Number of atoms in the index array.

briefdescription.para: Updates an index group mapping.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Mapping structure.
g
Current index group.
bMaskOnly
true if the unused blocks should be masked with -1 instead of removing them.
Updates the index group mapping with the new index group g.

briefdescription.para: Frees memory allocated for index group mapping.

detaileddescription.para:
m
Mapping structure to free.
All the memory allocated for the mapping structure is freed, and the pointers set to NULL. The pointer m is not freed.

briefdescription.para: Implements functions in indexutil.h.
